item.description:
Winner - Palme d'Or - 2011 Cannes Film Festival. Brad Pitt, Sean Penn and Jessica Chastain star in Terrence Malick's (Badlands,The Thin Red Line) new film.

The Tree of Life is the impressionistic story of a Midwestern family in the 1950's. The film follows the life journey of the family's eldest son, Jack, through the innocence of childhood to his disillusioned adult years as he tries to reconcile a complicated relationship with his father (Brad Pitt). Jack (played as an adult by Sean Penn) finds himself a lost soul in the modern world, seeking answers to the origins and meaning of life, while questioning the existence of faith. Through Malick's signature imagery, we see how both brute nature and spiritual grace shape not only our lives as individuals and families, but all life.

From the AV Club:  A

The Tree Of Life has a vision that makes most movies look like crude stick drawings. On balance, the question of why someone has to die is made to seem absurdly narrow, because a single life seems so insignificant in the vastness of time and space. Yet The Tree Of Life isn’t despairing about it in the least; it’s a genuine attempt to grasp the transcendent, and the rare religious film that deserves to be called spiritual in scale, The Tree Of Life recalls the mammoth ambition of Stanley Kubrick’s2001: A Space Odyssey, but it’s also more intimate and personal than Malick’s previous films, rooted in vivid memories of growing up in ’50s Texas.

 

I strongly encourage you to purchase your ticket early: http://www.coolidge.org/content/tree-lifehttp

This film might sell out, even with the early start time.  Don't leave yourself in the position of getting shut out when you can secure your ticket ahead of time!

After the film, look for me standing like a Tree, full Of a Life affirming Meetup sign.  In the history of the galaxy, it might not mean more than squat, but we'll go to a nearby eatery for food/drink/discussion.  We will definitely wait outside the Coolidge and gather as a group before going, anywhere so that you cannot miss us.

See you at the movie,

John
